meta.title: API Create: Brandfetch Integration
meta.description: Complete 13-phase workflow demonstrating interview-driven, research-first API development

steps.content: The term "brandfetch" could refer to multiple things. Let me search for variations...

Found 3 potential meanings:

  1. Brandfetch.com API - Logo and brand asset retrieval service
  2. Generic brand fetching - Custom brand data scraping
  3. Brand identity extraction - AI-based brand analysis

Let me confirm my understanding of what you want to build:

  Endpoint: /api/v2/brandfetch
  Purpose:  Fetch brand assets (logos, colors, fonts) from Brandfetch.com
  Method:   POST (with domain input)
  Output:   Brand data including logos in multiple formats

Research complete. Here's what I discovered:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  BRANDFETCH API - Research Summary                          │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  Base URL:     https://api.brandfetch.io/v2                 │
│  Auth:         Bearer token (API key)                       │
│  Rate Limit:   100 requests/minute                          │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  ENDPOINTS DISCOVERED:                                      │
│  • GET /brands/:domain - Fetch brand by domain              │
│  • GET /brands/:domain/logos - Logos only                   │
│  • GET /brands/:domain/colors - Colors only                 │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  RESPONSE FIELDS:                                           │
│  • name (string) - Brand name                               │
│  • domain (string) - Website domain                         │
│  • logos[] - Array of logo objects                          │
│    - type: "logo" | "icon" | "symbol"                       │
│    - formats[]: { src, format, size }                       │
│  • colors[] - Brand colors (hex, type)                      │
│  • fonts[] - Typography info                                │
│  • description (string) - Brand description                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
Should I proceed with this research, or search for more details?

Based on my research, I have specific questions about your requirements.
These questions are generated FROM the discovered API parameters.

Q1/5: Brandfetch returns logos in multiple formats (SVG, PNG, JPEG).
       Which formats should we support?
       [a] SVG only (smallest, scalable)
       [b] PNG only (universal support)
       [c] All formats (let user choose)
       [d] SVG + PNG (recommended)

Q2/5: The API provides colors, fonts, AND logos.
       Which data should we fetch?
       [a] Logos only
       [b] Logos + colors
       [c] Logos + colors + fonts
       [d] Everything available

Q3/5: Logo types available: "logo", "icon", "symbol".
       Which types should we return?
       [a] Primary logo only
       [b] Logo + icon
       [c] All types

Q4/5: Rate limiting is 100 req/min.
       How should we handle rate limit errors?
       [a] Return error immediately
       [b] Retry with exponential backoff (recommended)
       [c] Queue requests
Rate limiting: Retry with exponential backoff

Q5/5: Should we cache responses?
       [a] No caching
       [b] Cache for 1 hour
       [c] Cache for 24 hours (recommended - brand data rarely changes)
       [d] Custom TTL
Interview complete. Saving decisions to state file...

Based on your interview answers, I'd like to research:

  1. Brandfetch exponential backoff best practices
  2. Logo format conversion (SVG to PNG if needed)

These searches are proposed, not automatic.
WebSearch: "SVG PNG logo format best practices"
Creating Zod schema from research + interview decisions...
All required API keys are configured
Creating test file based on schema and interview decisions...
Running tests (expected to fail - no implementation yet)...
FAIL  5 tests failed (as expected in RED phase)
RED phase complete - tests written and failing
Writing minimal implementation to pass all tests...
Re-reading Brandfetch documentation to verify implementation...

Verification Results:

  ✓ Endpoint URL correct
  ✓ Authentication header format correct
  ✓ Response schema matches documentation
  ✓ Logo formats handled correctly
  ✓ Rate limiting retry implemented

No gaps found between implementation and documentation.

Cleaning up code while keeping tests green...

  • Extracted fetchWithRetry to shared utility
  • Added JSDoc comments
  • Improved error messages
  • Added OpenAPI documentation
All tests still passing after refactor

Updating documentation...

  ✓ OpenAPI spec updated
  ✓ api-tests-manifest.json updated
  ✓ registry.json updated
  ✓ Research cached to .claude/research/brandfetch/

Final verification checklist:

  ✓ All tests passing (5/5)
  ✓ TypeScript compilation successful
  ✓ Schema validated
  ✓ Documentation complete
  ✓ Research cached
  ✓ Registry updated
View at /api-showcase or run: pnpm dev

╭─────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│  Workflow Complete                                  │
│                                                     │
│  Files created:                                     │
│  • src/app/api/v2/brandfetch/route.ts              │
│  • src/lib/schemas/brandfetch.ts                   │
│  • src/app/api/v2/brandfetch/__tests__/...         │
│                                                     │
│  Time: 3m 42s                                       │
╰─────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
